intro: Alchemilla kishangangensis, commonly known as the Himalayan lady’s mantle, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters. Alchemilla kishangangensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
